q_en: For cutting task with ID=19, allocate cutting materials from the Main Warehouse, with the material type being Cotton Fabric and a quantity of 30 meters.
gt:
Sure thing! Let's get those materials allocated for your cutting task. Here's the breakdown of the allocation:

| Task ID | Warehouse Name | Material Type  | Quantity |
|---------|----------------|----------------|----------|
| 19      | Main Warehouse | Cotton Fabric  | 30 meters|

Everything is set for your task! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. ğŸ˜Š

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM warehouse WHERE name = 'Main Warehouse';
steps.description: Retrieve the warehouse ID for the warehouse with the name "Main Warehouse"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM materials WHERE name = 'Cotton Fabric';
steps.description: Retrieve the material ID for the material with the name "Cotton Fabric"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM warehouse_material WHERE warehouse_id = '1' AND material_id = '1';
steps.description: Retrieve the warehouse material ID for the specific warehouse and material

steps.sql: INSERT INTO cutting_material_allocation (warehouse_material_id, cutting_task_id, allocated_num, is_allocated) VALUES ('1', 19, 30, TRUE);
steps.description: Allocate 30 meters of "Cotton Fabric" from "Main Warehouse" to the cutting task with ID=19

response:
Sure thing! Let's get those materials allocated for you. Here's a summary of the allocation:

| Task ID | Warehouse        | Material Type  | Quantity (meters) | Allocation Status |
|---------|------------------|----------------|-------------------|-------------------|
| 19      | Main Warehouse   | Cotton Fabric  | 30                | Allocated         |

We've successfully allocated 30 meters of Cotton Fabric from the Main Warehouse for your cutting task with ID 19. ğŸ‰ If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! ğŸ˜Š
